fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41250].
  {panel}

Current page to manage project categories doesn't allow you to associate projects to a category.

In other words, it means that if you want to add 10 projects to a specific category, you have to visit all 10 projects and associate each one of them to the category.

After a design discussion with [~dhudson], we considered it would be important to add a project picker to both create and edit project category, allowing a quick administration of the associated categories.

This board picker should offer an experience similar to the fields in the "Create Issue" dialog, where you start typing, select an option and move to the next selection (check attached .gif).
fields.summary: Add project picker to create/edit project category

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41247].
  {panel}

*In JIRA 5.x*
* When you disable the inline edit configuration (Administration > System > General Configuration), it will *still show* the pencil icon/inline edit icon even after adding a label.

*In JIRA 6.x*
* When you disable the inline edit configuration (Administration > System > General Configuration), it will *not show* the pencil icon/inline edit icon when there are existing value in the label field.

It is confusing for customer when they upgrade from JIRA 5.x to JIRA 6.x and they do not know where to edit the label field coming from the previous version of JIRA. The intended behaviour could be improve and align with the previous version of JIRA.


*Workaround*
# Go to More > Labels
# Press shortcut key *i* on the keyboard
fields.summary: inconsistency for inline edit on system field - label

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41246].
  {panel}

The basic idea is this:  The dashboard would work exactly as it does today but it would allow you to define search text for that dashboard.  The search text would be added to ALL of the searches used for that dashboard.  

For example, I could add the search text "AND SomeField=SomeValue".  This text would be added to the search text for each widget.  So if the first widget used the search text "project=aa and Field1=bb" then the modified search text would be "project=aa and Field1=bb AND SomeField=SomeValue"

Here is my use case:

I have about 6 dashboards that are all identical to each other except for one thing:  Each dashboard has a unique value for one attribute in the searches that are used for that dashboard.  

To make this happen I start by creating a set of searches which are used by my dashboard widgets.  Then I need to copy all of those searches and modify this one attribute in all of them.  Then I copy the dashboard and edit all of the gadgets to use the new searches.  It is a lot of work.  But worse, if I need to modify any of my searches then I need to modify all 6 copies.
fields.summary: Add search filter to the Dashboard
Give the possibilitie of add the Single Level Group By Report in a dashboard
Display column header for the Issue Links section on the issue view

            <ww:property value="/field('issuetype')/createHtml(null, /, /, /issueObject, /displayParams)" escape="'false'" />


Thanks
RK

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41230].
  {panel}

I'd like sub-task issue keys to inherit the issue key of their parent issues.

E.g. so if a Story has issue key FOO-22, when its sub-tasks are created they are given issue keys along the lines of FOO-22-1, FOO-22-2, FOO-22-3, etc.

Benefit: big improvement in clarity on Agile boards.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Allow subtasks issue keys to inherit the parent issue's key.
Newly Created Subtask from a Parent Issue Should be Shown after its' Creation
Wrong or incomplete documentation about pre-population of field when 'Creating Another' issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41227].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA knows an issue is unresolved when the resolution field is not set. It determines, for example, if a link to the issue should have a strikethrough or not.

Also, [the documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+Resolution+Field+Values] states that a user shouldn't create an 'Unresolved' resolutions, because JIRA will not handle the issue as 'Unresolved' when using this resolution.

This approach has a very problematic characteristic: the resolution field is mandatory, but it not being set has a meaning! It is unresolved.

This brings a few problems:
* There is no flexibility. The users need to either use a post function and trigger a transition or change in the database in case they want to change a resolved issue to 'unresolved'
* We cannot add the 'resolution' field to the 'Edit' Screen for an issue type in a project. If that is done, the user must always set the resolution when editing the issue, even if they wanted to change a completely different field

My suggestion is to add a 'Unresolved' resolution, rather than understanding it as unresolved when this field is not set. It would have the following characteristics:
* This resolution cannot be deleted or modified
* This is a _special_ resolution. When an issue has this resolution, JIRA considers it as unresolved (no strikethrough, etc.)
* You need permission to set as unresolved (otherwise, only the other options will appear)
* If the issue is set as unresolved, it can remain that way, no need to change it when editing an issue.

I think this resolves a question:
How can a required field give a meaning to an unset value?
fields.summary: Create embedded 'Unresolved' resolution

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41226].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
In the notification scheme, no one is set to receive Issue Updated, but users are set to receive Issue Commented. When a comment is added via email, nobody gets notification. When a comment is added via UI, they get notification for Issue Commented.

After some testing I found that commenting via email will trigger Issue Updated, that is the reason users don't receive notification even though they are supposed to receive for Issue Commented. By right commenting via email and UI should behave the same and trigger Issue Commented and users should get notification.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Install JIRA
# Configure Incoming Mail Handler (Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue) and Outgoing Mail
# Remove everyone from *Issue Updated* event but make sure they receive notifications from *Issue Commented* event
# Have a user add a comment to a particular issue via email

h4. Expected Results
# Comment added successfully
# Designated users receive notification
# Notification sent with *Issue Commented* event

h4. Actual Results
# Comment added successfully
# No notification received by users who supposed to receive *Issue Commented* event

h4. Notes
* When the users are configured to receive notification from *Issue Updated* event, then commenting via email will send notifications to the designated users
* Affecting with JIRA 6.3.10 and 6.3.12
* With 6.2.7, notification will be of *Issue Commented* event (intended behavior)
fields.summary: Comments From Email Trigger Notifications for "Issue Updated" Instead of "Issue Commented" Event
Update the JIRA Timesheet Plugin to version 2.8.2.5 in Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41218].
  {panel}

The What's new welcome message in recent versions are not showing the JIRA version. JIRA 6.2 had it, but JIRA 6.3.11 doesn't have it.

It would be nice to bring back the version number, since it helps JIRA Administrators to communicate about the latest JIRA version and also helps users be aware of the latest version.

h3.JIRA 6.3.11 - What's new dialog
!JIRA_Whats_New.png!

h3.Workaround
* JIRA Version is always listed at the page footer.
* Administrators need to use the *Introduction* field from JIRA _General Configuration_ to provide the JIRA version.
fields.summary: Please bring back the JIRA version on what's new

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41216].
  {panel}

I have replicated this on JIRA 6.3.12
h4. Steps to Replicate
# Create a user (e.g. {{jsmith}}).
# Change its username (e.g. to {{john.smith}})
# Go to any issue and select {{john.smith}} as either the assignee or the reporter.
# Click on the History tab.
# The change will display the username {{jsmith}} instead of {{john.smith}}:
!userkey.png!

*Expected Result*
Since the user key is only used internally by the application, we should not expose this information to end-users. The current username should be displayed instead ({{john.smith}}).

Additional information about the user rename feature:
https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Renamable+Users+in+JIRA+6.0
fields.summary: Issue history displays user key instead of username for reporter or assignee changes
Specify better the error when restoring a backup.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41214].
  {panel}

The REST API documentation should be improved with the possible parameters when running a reindex via REST.

We have two options when specifying the string parameter "type" however, in the documentation there is no mention of the options, which are "BACKGROUND" and "FOREGROUND".

It can make some friction with the customer who is trying to create some REST calls.

Documentation: https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/
fields.summary: Reindex REST endpoint missing parameters in the documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41213].

Our team manages deployments for all our cloud customers. As such, I'm marking this request for improved platform support as invalid.

We have a related Jira Server ticket for this issue, see linked issues and watch that for updates on our [Jira Server and Data Center products here.|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41213]

Thanks!

Steve King
Product Manager
  {panel}

From Oracle Docs: https://docs.oracle.com/cd/B28359_01/server.111/b28326/repmaster.htm#i32372

{quote}
Alternatives to Replicating Sequences

Because two sequences at different databases can generate the same value, replicating sequences is not supported.
...
...
{quote}

Can an alternative be implemented?
fields.summary: Alternative to Oracle Not Supporting Replication of Sequences

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41212].
  {panel}

h6. Problem
If you have issues on a JIRA instance that are assigned to an user that does not exist in the instance *and* the username has a dot (.) in it. This scenario can typically happen when you import a project from another instance.

h6. Steps to reproduce
# Either try to import a project from another instance that has at least one ticket assigned to an user with dot in the username and that user does not exist in the target instance. Alternatively you can try and update {{jiraissue}} table's assignee field to a sample username like 'some.thing' for an issue, then reindex the project.
# Check the project summary page and notice the issue to be listed under 'Unassigned'
# Clicking the unassigned link will redirect you to an issue result set that contains no issues (if there are no unassigned issues in the project)
fields.summary: Issues classified as unassigned if the assignee does not exist and has a dot in the username

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41203].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce : 
# Create a user(lets say 'test') and using the user, perform certain actions on any issue (like adding issue links, comments etc)
# Notice that the issue history tab shows changes made by this user 'test'.
# Now rename this user from administration console giving it a new username (say 'testabc').
# Now make some more changes to the issue using this renamed user.
# Now go to the history tab and notice that the old username 'test' is still being used. The new username 'testabc' is never used in the history tab.

This is expected behaviour looking at the way JIRA has been designed (checking for username field in table 'userhistoryitem' instead of user id). However for a user, this is a bug.
fields.summary: History tab shows old username after rename of username

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

1. Create a issue filter with JQL "labels is not EMPTY"
2. Add a pie chart gadget which uses the above created filter.
3. Notice the statistics on the gadget. The Total issue count is less than the Other Issue count.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41191].
  {panel}

Recently the design of the Smart query notification message has been updated in JIRA OnDemand. Whereas it used to be an unobtrusive message that would disappear shortly, it now appears as a yellow warning message in a location that covers several important buttons and even lingers on screen after following a link to an issue page from the search results.

There are a few things that could be implemented to make that notification less intrusive:

# Move the message to an unobtrusive location.
# Provide configuration options to disable the display of that notification.
# Make the notification disappear after a short time.
# At least make the notification disappear when the user is no longer on the search results page.
fields.summary: Improvements For The Smart Query Notification Banner

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41190].
  {panel}

It would be better to have the option for JIRA JQL Auto-complete to display the list in DESCENDING order

Example of use-case:
When the user has long list of "Version", it will display the old versions, while the user is intending to choose the recent version. 

Thus, it would be great to have the option of Descending order for JQL auto-complete
fields.summary: To have the option for JIRA JQL Auto-complete to display the list in DESCENDING order
Ability to have Customfield context for each IssueType of a Project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41181].
  {panel}

Basically, JQL doesn't worry about the case for labels (mylabel == MYLABEL) but when creating an issue, the component does care about the sensitivity of the case (mylabel != MYLABEL) which is inconsistent behaviour. 

To reproduce:

1. Create a new issue
2. Give it label 'MYLABEL' all uppercase
3. Create the issue
4. Create another issue, and start typing 'MYL' to see that it suggests 'MYLABEL' as an existing label.
5. Delete this text and start typing 'myl' in lowercase and see that it wants to create a new label.
6. Don't create an issue and close the dialog.
7. Go to issue navigator
8. Type in JQL labels = 'mylabel'
9. See that the issue with label 'MYLABEL' appears
fields.summary: Labels are not case sensitive in JQL but are case sensitive when creating a label

I should be able to monitor incoming mails jobs
Mail Handler to only check the Subject header for creation and commenting on issues

fields.description:
Hi Experts

I have an issue with creating a default description based on Issue Type and Based on what Option is selected from the Custom Field.

Not sure whether I am working on this correctly but I will explain what I expecting first.

For Issue Type: Service Request I have a Custom Field Called Request Type (3 Options are available) For each of these 3 options when one is selected I would like a different Description to display. Currently it doesn't actually change the description based on Custom Field

This is my code what I have placed in /opt/jira/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/jira/issue/field/description_edit.vm

{noformat}
## =======================================
## START CUSTOMIZATION


## SET INCIDENT
#if (($issue.key == $null) && ($issue.getIssueTypeObject().getName() == "Incident"))
    #set ($description = 'h6. Steps to Reproduce
        # Navigate to ...
        # Click on ...
        \
        h6. Expected Results
        \
        h6. Actual Results
        \
        h6. Other Information (Browser, Browser Version, Environment)')
    #set ($description = $description.replace('\',''))


## SET SERVICE REQUEST 'NONE'
#elseif ((($issue.key == $null) && ($issue.getIssueTypeObject().getName() == "Service Request"))
        ($ComponentAccessor.getCustomFieldManager().getCustomFieldObjectByValue("customfield_11504")));
        #if ($getcustomfieldObjectByValue("customfield_11504").getOptionbyName == "Enhancement")
        #set ($description = 'Please select a Request Type')
        #set ($description = $description.replace('\',''))


## SET SERVICE REQUEST 'DEPLOYMENT'
    #elseif ($OptionManager.getOption == "Deployment")
        #set ($description = 'h6. Name of System -
                \
                h6. Environment -
                \
                h6. Expected Delivery Date / Time -')
        #set ($description = $description.replace('\',''))

## SET SERVICE REQUEST 'NEW ACCOUNT'
        #else
                #if ($OptionManager.getOption == "New Account")
                #set ($description = 'h6. Are you requesting for a new account to be set up?
                /
                h6. Name of System -
                /
                h6. Name of New User -
                /
                h6. Contact Information (Email Address, Contact Number) -')
        #set ($description = $description.replace('\',''))
                #end
        #end


## SET CHANGE REQUEST
#else
        #if (($issue.key == $null) && ($issue.getIssueTypeObject().getName() == "Change Request"))
                #set ($description = 'h6. Change Logs
                \
                h6. Deployment Script
                \
                h6. Deployment Verification
                \
                h6. Roll Back Plan')
                #set ($description = $description.replace('\',''))
        #end
#end


## END CUSTOMIZATION
## =======================================
{noformat}

For incident and Change request these actually do change the description and these will not need to be changed or modified in anyway

Any help would be appreciated

Regards

Brian
fields.summary: Issue setting a default description based on Custom Field (Select List)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41169].
  {panel}

Scenario:

When creating an issue the administrator may want to give the user the option to assign the issue to someone specific, so the 'assignee' field is added to the issue create screen. The default value of the assignee field is the current user, so this means that any issue created will be assigned to the current user by default. It should be possible to configure a default value for the assignee field so that the freedom to choose assignee is available, but if the user doesn't choose an assignee then it will default to automatic.

Documentation states:
{quote}*Selecting a Default Assignee*
You can optionally set a Default Assignee for a component. This will override the project's default assignee, for issues in that component. If an issue has multiple components, and the default assignees of components clash, the assignee will be set to the default assignee of the component that is first alphabetically.
||Default Assignee Option||Description||Notes|
|Unassigned|The assignee of the issue will not be set on the creation of this issue.|This option will only be available if "Allow unassigned issues" is enabled in the General Configuration.| {quote}

Which is not happening.

*Workaround:*
# Set the assignee field manually.
OR
# Set a post-function on your workflow that overrides the assignee value the user sets. - the downside of this being that the user will be confused by the fact that they chose an assignee but it's ignored.
OR
# Remove the assignee field from the create issue screen so that it defaults to unassigned. - the downside being that you'll need to set up a new screen just for creating issues.
fields.summary: Set assignee field default value

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41157].
  {panel}

To work around the lack of bulk linking support (JRA-2428), I prepared a comma-separated list of issue keys, opened the "link issue" dialog and pasted the list into the issue key field. I would have expected either unmodified plain text, e.g.
bq. ABC-17,ABC-39,DEF-20,XYZ-1
or properly separated individual issue keys like
bq. \[ABC-17 ^x^\] \[ABC-39 ^x^\] \[DEF-20 ^x^\] \[XYZ-1 ^x^\]

However, JIRA turned the entire input into one issue key, something like this:
bq. \[ABC-17,ABC-39,DEF-20,XYZ-1 ^x^\]

When submitting the form, it then rejected this input, telling me an issue with the key {{ABC-17,ABC-39,DEF-20,XYZ-1}} did not exist.

AFAIK, commas are not a valid character in issue keys, so the behavior JIRA shows does not make any sense. It should be changed to produce one of the two expected results given above.

The same problem occurs when using spaces instead of commas.
fields.summary: Issue link dialog should allow a comma-separated list of issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41155].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there are times where an invalid XML character that is inserted into the instance can cause problems when trying to import the XML export of that instance. This can lead to frustrations (as they would either have to find it manually, or run the XML through the [XML cleaner|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Removing+invalid+characters+from+XML+backups].

h3. Suggested Solution
It would more effective (and efficient) if the import can automatically filter out these invalid characters. A better (but possibly tougher alternative) would be to disallow those characters from being inserted into the instance in the first place.
fields.summary: Have some way to filter out invalid XML characters when importing (or better yet, avoid them from being entered in the first place)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41154].

(See Screenshot)

fields.summary: Won't Do Resolution Added
Issue Search should display more clearly whether you are logged in or not

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41150].
  {panel}

The documentation page  [Cloning an Issue | https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Cloning+an+Issue] mentions that custom fields are cloned but has nothing regarding how cloning affects Agile Sprints. 

The number of votes/comments on [GHS-6541 | https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-6541] proves that this is something customers need to be aware of.
* There are also comments on the article itself regarding the sprint field and it being cloned

This suggestion is to either add info about JIRA Agile to that Clone Issue page or add a link to a page containing the caveats that a customer should be aware of. 
* An example would be [this KB article |  https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/Clear+Sprint+information+when+cloning+JIRA+issue]
fields.summary: Update Clone Issue Docs to include or link to JIRA Agile caveats
Can't add group to Global Permissions
Bugzilla Import definitions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41143].
  {panel}

In some circumstances an LDAP server can hang during a sync, which will cause JIRA to keep the sync action open indefinitely. It would be nice if the directory configuration page could show the following information:

- Current syncs running from the scheduler. 
- The amount of time the an active sync has been running
- A stop/reset button that will roll back to the previous state in case manual intervention is required
fields.summary: Add Ability to Reset/Stop an LDAP sync via GUI
Disabling warning notifications temporary

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41141].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour
Log work to an issue is still possible even if the issue version is "Version Unrelease" or "Archive Version"

h3. Feature Request
Log work to an issue should be restricted if the issue version is "Version Unrelease" or "Archive Version"
fields.summary: Log work to an issue should be restricted if the issue version is "Version Unrelease" or "Archive Version"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41139].
  {panel}

The new Browse Projects view (Projects > View all projects > (All Projects in sidebar)) introduced in 6.4-OD-11 takes away the ability to list all of your projects grouped by category. I understand why this needed to be done but it's definitely a loss (see original issue for discussion on that). 

I could use the new Browse Projects view if the *table columns were sortable*. Then I'd just click the project category column to sort it and have something close to what I had before. Even better (but not critical) would be to have a "printable" view of this page that listed all projects using the current column sorting. 

So I'm making this enhancement request. 

Use case is that I produce a weekly report for management listing current projects, grouped by category. I used the previous view to produce this but I can't easily produce it using the new view or any other workaround suggested by Support or Product Management.
fields.summary: Browse Projects enhancement - sortable table columns, printable view
Add "Share" operation to individual gadgets, similar to Share button on the issue navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41137].
  {panel}

When linking JIRA to 2 different Stash instances, the applinks page shows these 2 Stash instances with different Names e.g. Stash1, Stash2. Type is of course the same Stash.

When creating a branch from Development panel, JIRA will ask to select which application to create a branch in. Here it will show Type only. Users can differentiate the apps by their URLs, but this may sometimes be inconvenient:
!branch.png|thumbnail!

Suggestion is to display Application Name together with Type in this popup window.
fields.summary: Display Name together with Type when linking JIRA to multiple applications of the same type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41135].
  {panel}

The version currently bundled with JIRA OnDemand is 2.5.5.2
The most recent available version is 3.5.2
Since the version 3.x releases of this plugin, many changes have been applied and extra functions have become available. 
See [here|https://innovalog.atlassian.net/wiki/display/JMWE/JIRA+Misc+Workflow+Extensions+Documentation] for more details
fields.summary: Update JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions for JIRA OD
add system field to issue collector form
Error when using JQL to filter by Fix Version for Group (Anyone)
Replace JIRA CAPTCHA with reCAPTCHA
Hide column in Dashboard
Improve the Description of the 'Hide transition from user' Condition
Implement a Hide Transition workflow condition
Ability to Modify createdDate
Linked issue field cannot link to external JIRA instances

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41116].
  {panel}

h3.Symptoms
When the user log work on the issue, an notification will be sent out as issue updated.
!issue_update.PNG|thumbnail!
Even in the notification schemed is configure to have no notifications sent for all the work log event.
!notification_scheme.PNG|thumbnail!

This is replicable in the latest OnDemand release 6.4-OD-11-012

h3. Workaround
Disable the issue updated notification will prevent the notification sent for work logging event but of course no notifications will not be sent when issue updated as well.
fields.summary: Work Log Notification is Sent as Issue Updated
Automatic email address link doesn't support IDN
Header is displaced on IE11
When logging work, users are getting notifications when logged work is off
Issue Statistics widget calculates percentages incorrectly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41107].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently we get a generic error when the user is not able to access JIRA.
"jirauser tried to login but they do not have USE permission or weren't found."

h3. Suggested Solution
These are pretty distinctive reasons for the failed attempt and would be much more helpful if they had two separate error messages, one for the permission error ("do not have USE permission") and another for the LDAP search ("weren't found").
fields.summary: As an admin, I'd like a more detailed error message for failed login attempts
Create a report that shows what the Task Board looked like on any given day

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41104].
  {panel}

This request is from my question posted to Atlassian Answers:

Is it possible to move a dashboard from one instance to another?

Chris Volker about 17 hours ago
I have a user who has set-up extensive dashboards in one JIRA instance, and would like to move them to another.  I use Configuration Manager to make the snapshots and the deployment to the other instance.  So, the user should get his project and all associated elements, but not the dashboard(s) or his filters.  Can I move the dashboard independently for the user through other means?

Teilor Soares [Atlassian]about 6 hours ago
Hi Chris!
At this moment is not possible to export or import a dashboard. The only way to export a dashboard would be export the entire instance.
-Teilor
 CommentAccept answer
Peter Benabout 6 hours ago
Telior, do we have a JIRA ticket for this feature? Thanks
Teilor Soares [Atlassian]about 4 hours ago
No, we do not. You can create a new feature request in jira.atlassian.com. 

============================================
Thank you for considering this feature suggestion.

Chris
fields.summary: Ability to move a Dashboard(s) from one Jira Instance to another

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41102].
  {panel}

Sorry guys for misusing the product bugtracker, but I found no way of contacting a web-master from Atlassian. If there is such a link, I was unable to find it (and yes I have seen the contact form, but no category did fit my type of request).

On page: https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+Plugin+Guide
on the bottom of the page there is a bug: Error formatting macro: include: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No link could be created for 'DEVNET:_Copyright Notice'.

That does not look too professional.
fields.summary: Bug on Atlassian web-page for developers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41101].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour
Once you check turn on self sign up and save the settings, the checkbox will not be visible to verify that the feature is enabled. To disable it, you just need to click Save button. 

h3. Feature Request
Once you check turn on self sign up and save it, the checkbox should be visible to verify that the feature is enabled. To disable it, uncheck the check box and save button.
fields.summary: Check box for Turn on self signup should be visible after enabling the feature

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41100].
  {panel}

When you click search button in issue search, browser sends 2 or 3 request to this url: /rest/issueNav/1/issueTable/stable

It is causing following problems:
- flakiness of webdriver tests
- unnecessary issue re-render
- unnecessary request itself

Use this for more details: 
{code}JIRA.trace.callback = console.log.bind(console);{code}

!doublerequest.png!
fields.summary: Double request to /rest/issueNav/1/issueTable/stable on issue search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41098].
  {panel}

The UI updates introduced in 6.4-OD-11 have introduced a regression of functionality. Previously when viewing all projects (Projects > View all projects > (All Projects in sidebar)) they would be grouped by category, with a heading for each, all on one page. Now they're all listed together alphabetically across multiple pages. There is now no way to list all projects on one page, grouped by category. 

I relied on this view and consider its removal a regression.

I produce a weekly report for management listing current projects, grouped by category. I used the previous view to produce this but I can't easily produce it using the new view. Support tells me there's no workaround or alternate method to generate this.

Going forward, if there was an option to sort the category column and a way to view all projects on one page, this new view would work for me.
fields.summary: Regression: unable to list all projects grouped by category

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41097].
  {panel}

The same problem in [JRA-7925] still happens.

h3. Summary
In JIRA 3.3.2 Lead developer was changed to Project lead. However it was never changed in the workflows. 

!confusion.png|thumbnail!


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click post function on a workflow
# You will see the option for assign to lead developer which was changed to project lead in the project UI on [JRA-7925|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-7925]

h3. Expected Results
Workflow post function would reflect assign to project lead. 
h3. Actual Results
It says lead developer instead of project lead.
!confusion.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Regression: "Lead Developer" should be "Project Lead"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41093].
  {panel}

Hi,
          I am currently working on jira workflow post functions. I need to right a sil codes for post function. Is there any way we can define a variables in sil which can hold a value between two transitions of workflow.
Thanks
Mahesh Dubey
fields.summary: Global Variables for entire workflow

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Thanks for trying out our early look at our next release. You can download the latest EAP release (milestone build, beta or release candidate) [here|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download-eap].

Please read through [Preparing for JIRA 6.4|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Preparing+for+JIRA+6.4] if you are a plugin developer.

Simply comment below for any comments you may have.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41085].
  {panel}

On project CMSC, the QA Manager has the following options on some bugs but not others:
-Return to Requester
-Reject

Bug CMSC-784 has these options for the role QA Manager, but bug CMSC-609 does *not* have these options for the same role.
fields.summary: Bugs have different workflow options on the same project for the same role
Work logged on issue seems to be treated as generic event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41083].
  {panel}

The documentation for delegated LDAP and nested groups does not indicate that there isn't any current support for nested groups and delegated LDAP.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+to+an+Internal+Directory+with+LDAP+Authentication

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Nested+Groups#ManagingNestedGroups-EffectofNestedGroups

Neither one of these documents reflects a current JAC ticket that indicates a lack of support for nested groups and delegated LDAP:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-25709
fields.summary: Update documentation to reflect lack of support for delegated LDAP and nested groups
Option to disable the refresh message in the Wallboard View
Allow for editing of the information within the 'Scheduler Details'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41074].

The release information and .OBR download is available in the marketplace listing: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.gliffy.integration.jira/versions#b492

Notable improvements and fixes:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41059].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a JIRA project and a linked Bamboo plan
# Create a version in JIRA and release it with a new Bamboo build
# Delete that Bamboo build
# Try to release the same version again

h3. Current behaviour

JIRA displays the error as in:

!https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/166347/KBtKTZIOhFDzg9k/Capture.PNG | height=200px!

h3. Expected behaviour

Display a message clearly stating that the previous release has been deleted, as the current message can lead to believe that there are errors in the application link, such as JIRA not being able to reach Bamboo.
fields.summary: Trying to release a version again after deleting the original build will show "Bamboo unreachable error"
Wrong updateAuthor on worklogs when logging for others.
why don't save condition & postfunction in jwb file exported from my workflow
